 A macro that defines the state of a binding cache entry, the state here is "unknown entry".
#define BCE_PMIP   5
 A macro that defines the state of a binding cache entry, the state here is "registered pmip entry".
#define BCE_TEMP   6
 A macro that defines the state of a binding cache entry, the state here is "binding cache entry waiting for registration".

int pmip_cache_iterate (int(*func)(void *, void *), void *arg)
 Apply function to every BC entry. Iterates through proxy binding cache, calling func for each entry. Extra data may be passed to func in arg.func takes a bcentry as its first argument and arg as second argument.

Variables

 Global var mutex on the binding cache.
router_ad_iface_t router_ad_iface
 Router advertisement structure containing all information that will be sent in the router advertisement message by MAGs.

Detailed Description

PMIP CACHE

Define Documentation

#define BCE_TEMP   6

A macro that defines the state of a binding cache entry, the state here is "binding cache entry waiting for registration".

Note:
This state is possible only on MAG entities, not LMA.

Function Documentation

void dump_pbce ( void *  bce,
void *  os 
)

Dump in an output stream, the content of a binding cache entry.

Parameters:
[in] bce A binding cache entry.
[in] os An output stream.
int get_pmip_cache_count ( int  type  ) 
Parameters:
[in] type The type of binding cache entry
Returns:
The number of binding cache entries in the cache.
void pmip_bce_delete ( pmip_entry_t *  bce  ) 

Remove a binding cache entry from the binding cache and free it.

Parameters:
[in] bce a binding cache entry
pmip_entry_t * pmip_cache_add ( pmip_entry_t *  bce  ) 

Add an entry in the binding cache.

Parameters:
[in] bce a binding cache entry
Returns:
The binding cache entry if success, else NULL.
Note:
If the binding cache entry type is BCE_PMIP, then a timer is started by a call to pmip_cache_start.
pmip_entry_t * pmip_cache_alloc ( int  type  ) 

Allocates a new binding cache entry. Returns allocated space (pmip_entry_t*) for an entry or NULL if errors.

Parameters:
[in] type The type of binding cache entry
Returns:
The allocated binding cache entry or NULL if memory space available or if initialization of the binding cache entry failled.
void pmip_cache_delete ( const struct in6_addr *  our_addr,
const struct in6_addr *  peer_addr 
)

Search a binding cache entry in the binding cache corresponding to a tupple of addresses and remove this binding cache entry from the binding cache and free it.

Parameters:
[in] our_addr the IPv6 fixed address of the PMIP entity
[in] peer_addr peer hardware address (link-layer address)
int pmip_cache_exists ( const struct in6_addr *  our_addr,
const struct in6_addr *  peer_addr 
)

Check the existence of a binding cache entry for a tuple of addresses in the binding cache.

Parameters:
[in] our_addr the IPv6 fixed address of the PMIP entity
[in] peer_addr peer hardware address (link-layer address)
Returns:
The type of the binding cache entry if found, -1 if entry not found.
Note:
If a binding cache entry is found, its mutex is unlocked.
pmip_entry_t * pmip_cache_get ( const struct in6_addr *  our_addr,
const struct in6_addr *  peer_addr 
)

Add an entry in the binding cache.

Parameters:
[in] our_addr the IPv6 fixed address of the PMIP entity
[in] peer_addr peer hardware address (link-layer address)
Returns:
The corresponding cache entry, else NULL.
Note:
If a binding cache entry is returned, its mutex is write locked, pmip mutex "pmip_lock" is also read-write locked.
int pmip_cache_init ( void   ) 

Initialize the pmip cache.

Returns:
The status of the initialization.
int pmip_cache_iterate ( int(*)(void *, void *)  func,
void *  arg 
)

Apply function to every BC entry. Iterates through proxy binding cache, calling func for each entry. Extra data may be passed to func in arg.func takes a bcentry as its first argument and arg as second argument.

Parameters:
[in] func the int (*func) (void *, void *) function pointer to apply to every binding cache entry.
[in] arg extra data for func
Returns:
The iterate status.
int pmip_cache_start ( pmip_entry_t *  bce  ) 

Start a timer on a binding cache entry.

Parameters:
[in] bce a binding cache entry
Returns:
Always 0.
Note:
A task queue element (see tqueue.c) is created and managed by a timed thread
void pmipcache_free ( pmip_entry_t *  bce  ) 

Free the allocated memory of a binding cache entry.

Parameters:
[in] bce a binding cache entry
void pmipcache_release_entry ( pmip_entry_t *  bce  ) 

Unlocks a binding cache entry.

Parameters:
[in] bce a binding cache entry
Note:
"pmip_lock" mutex is also unlocked.
